Pre-Game Insights: Wales secured a 3-1 friendly victory at home against Iceland in the last meeting between these two nations in March 2014
Wales have made an unbeaten start to their 2024-25 Nations League campaign
Iceland have been inconsistent for much of 2024, alternating between victory and defeat in each of their last six internationals across all competitions
Iceland are bidding to finish top of League B and secure promotion back to League A
Wales will climb to the top of Group B if they beat Iceland on Friday for the first time away from home since 1980
Iceland defender Sverrir Ingi Ingason has returned to the senior squad after missing last month's international break through injury
34-year-old Joe Allen has returned to the international setup after being persuaded by Bellamy to come out of retirement
Rhys Norrington-Davies has been called up for the first time in over two years following a troublesome spell on the sidelines with injury
Miscellaneous Highlights: Iceland have won three and drawn one of their last four games at home
Wales have not won on the road in their last 11 matches across all competitions
Brennan Johnson has scored six goals in as many games for Tottenham Hotspur
